history.content:
For 162: 3 midterms, 4 homeworks, 4 partners.

homeworks, projects, and midterms all overlap in time frame (sometimes due dates/midterm dates even overlap), so the workload is pretty high and constant, and the next hw/project releases as soon as the previous hw/project is due.

that said, if you have a good group, it's managable. for context, i'm in 4 techs right now (w/ teaching and research).

someone can add on about 161.

-----

Speaking to the workload of 162, the homeworks aren't super heavy. They're extremely straightforward in what they ask for (e.g. "implement a function that replicates malloc"), so if you understand the concepts behind the tasks, it only takes a few hours to complete on average. The projects are really dependent on how well your group functions together as well as the individual ability of the group members. For example, my group spent ~8-10 total working hours implementing the first project, but I know groups that totaled close to 3 or 4 times this amount. So really the workload in 162 is largely dependent on your group so take that into consideration when finding group members. Another thing is that 162 typically doesn't have a final, opting for 3 midterms paired with the 3 projects instead.

When I took 161 (this past spring), we had 4 homeworks, 3 projects, 2 midterms, and a final. The homeworks were just problem sets so they only took maybe 2-3 hours each going in-depth. One thing is that the homeworks were done on LaTeX so that could add to your perceived workload if you aren't super comfortable with it. The projects were groups of 2 but you are free to work by yourself, with project difficulty ranging widely. The first project was medium-ish (took me ~12 hours total), the second project was massive (~30 hours total), and the last project was a breeze (~2-3 hours total). Personally, I felt like my individual workload in 161 was a lot more than it has been in 162, but I was fortunate enough to find a stellar project group for 162 so I can't say if that's the case for others that have taken both classes.

If these are your only 2 technicals and your other courses aren't too time consuming then you should definitely have time to join clubs/participate in other things during the semester. While the workload in the classes is underrated, 161 especially, it's really manageable with good study and work habits!

someone can add on about 161.

Want to start off learning well in the courses. Any tips and insight into the class would be great.

Some other Q's I have:

1) How many midterms?

2) How many hws?

3) How many partners?

Will I have time to join clubs on my spare time? It's only 2 technicals, but I hear both are underrated in workload. I don't want to spend everyday working on projects in my last semester. If that's the case, I might decide to take a tech elective instead of 161.
history.subject: Tips on Succeeding for 162? How About 161?
